main event: On July 17, 1966, observers at Ernest Harmon Air Force Base in Canada reported seeing a bright, shiny object which appeared to hover in place, later determined to be a weather balloon.
interesting points: The object was observed for one hour,The altitude of the balloon was estimated to be between 48,000 and 49,000 feet,The object was first noted around 1735 hours and was visible until approximately 1835 hours,Multiple military personnel confirmed the sighting,The object did not produce any sound and appeared to be reflective and capsule-shaped.
sighted object: a bright, shiny object resembling a weather balloon
witness description: military personnel at the airbase including Major Beasley, Major Lapping, Major Barrios and Colonel Edington
